column11: Review Text

We have been on the beach for a few days and have loved it. It is so beautiful and relaxing, there's a lovely selection of places to eat and drink when you walk down the beach with hammocks and great settings. The only downside to this beach is that you can't swim in the water, we saw a few people try but it made the restaurant owners very nervous and they went to have a word with them after running out with the live saver ring.
+ nice beach for walking and taking pictures + relaxed/ almost deserted feeling - rough waters - prices as high as in Mirissa (for acommodation and food) - places where the beach was not so clean

Perhaps wrong time,  i don't know.. But tangalle, in total ,was a disappointment .. Beach is clean and beautiful only to look from distant..  Despite of many tourists, we didn't see anyone going in the water, we too were only on the shores with loads of small crabs due to ferocious waves  .. I couldn't enjoy it as much as i do when we go to a beach destination ,due to rough sea.. In month of December,  you can easily strike this off from your todo , without hesitation..
Man made breakwaters give safe swimming areas, the sea is warm and lovely to bob about in for hours, there can be a strong undertow and some strong currents so the safe areas are great.

While staying at the Harmony at Medilla Beach I had all my meals at the hotel.....there was no reason to venture further! Although the menu is basic, it's well prepared using fresh local ingredients .  The beers are cold and I took a particular liking to the Mojitos! They were 5 star at a 2 star price!

The beach itself looks picturesque from a distance though when up close you see quite a bit of rubbish. As the lagoon comes in close by the water is murky which for me was unexpected. There is quite a large swell with rips and currents which I would recommend except for stronger swimmers.
One of the best beaches to spend time . We had a wonderful time there.  No life guards in the vicinity .
No any complains about the area except rough sea... real paradise for relaxing, very peaceful and quirt. You'll hear only the natural sounds and can both sunrise n' sunset. Highly recommended

This beach is one of the peaceful beaches in Sri Lanka even during the Tourist season. This is not as happening as the Mirissa beach but it is quite a nice place that anyone should not miss. There are many beach hottels available around and the Tangalle lagoon is also situated near Madilla beach. I usually some here to get away from dress I deal in Colombo. It is relaxing to lay down one a Sun bed or swing in a hammock with a nice icedtea in the day time or to have a Mojito in the evening while you enjoying the sea breeze. Just like in Bentota, Madilla also is the pics to experience a beautiful sunsets. If you wake up little early in the morning you get to see thousands of parrots in this area starting their day.
Beautiful beach with big waves. Nice place to stay and a lot more quiet than other beaches. We stayed at Harmony Beach Bungalows and loved it! There is safe swimming behind the stones.
A fine beach with a good selection of hotels and eateries ranging from budget to top-end. Better quality hotels are at the far end of the beach, away from the town.

in the deep down south sri lanka  best beach . somany hotels , gust housess, small and big cabanas eazyaly can find on the beach. specialy in the night time some areias sea turtuls wee can see they comes to beach laying eggs.

A lovely beach with very few people. Don't listen to what others say about not being able to swim, it's a great beach to swim, there are small shore dumpers that's all. Europeans might not be used to this but if you are from USA, Australia, South Africa etc its a tame beach really.

We stayed at Ganesh Beach Cabanas (which I can recommend) and the beach here is beautiful. There was no waste on the beach and in the sea! The more you go to the west (to Tangalle), the more waste you can find on the beach, but it's still not dirty there. Most hotels are hidden behind palms and therefore the beach looks natural, there are no big hotel complexes. The sea is not for swimming because of the waves and more important because of the rocks, but it's possible to go into the water for cooling. We haven't been alone at the beach, but it was far from beeing crowded! You have enough space at the beach!

Beach is undoubthfully beautiful! Yellow sand, blue water, sun. No sun beds, tourists, cafes. Very tranquil place. You can call it paradise if you're sick of popular so called 'best beaches' where people lay one next to another, shouting beverages sellers are everywhere, and there's not ever a square meter of sand for your child to build a sand castle. This is a place where you can enjoy the sounds of nature, reset yourself.
A very rocky beach with a big shore dump. A small area behind a break wall that is safe for swimming

Simply paradise. We enjoyed the loneliness on the beach as well as cleanliness and very nice sea with large waves (which were unfortunately unsafe for swimming, which is the only shame there - You cannot go to the sea or just to the very edge, 2 meters maximum).

Relaxing and lovely...beautiful, we based ourselves at ibis guesthouse and walked along the palm fringed almost empty beach...the waves are very powerful at this time of year so swimming is out of the question but it was very calm and fun to skip in and out of the waves at the waters edge. Recommend

The beach is clean and beautiful, and you can have it almost by yourself. However, it was quite windy, and the waves made it impossible to swim (but quite fun to play in the waves). There are many restaurants along the beach, but the quality varies.. Find a good one and stick to that (like Ibis, Chance Lanka, Zanzibar). The closer you walk to the town Tangalle, the more stray dogs you'll see, and many of them have scabies, or are hurt in one way or the other. It is very sad to see that the locals and the tourism industry doesn't seem to see this as a problem.

This is the perfect beach if you want it to yourself! Only a few people ambling up and down and very relaxing. Unfortunately, the water is very rough with big waves and strong currents. Not too nice for a casual paddle but if you can bear it, it's worth a visit! Perhaps bring a good book...!
good beach to relax and fun...more activities can be done on this beach.specially near suwaya villa hotel becah is private beach and you can relax as much as possible.
The beach is beautiful & due to the season very little people, no rubbish but at the time the ocean was quite rough but some parts were ok to swim, in the season i am told its possible.
We came during the off season so the ocean was not as calm as it should be but there are a number of spots where it is possible to swim. The beach is amazingly clean with refreshing cool waters.
Shame it was monsoon so aves were too big to allow swimming but loved meeting people and local food was great Recommend hiring a scooter to get around and see villages, beaches and temples.
Beautiful sand , coconut palms all along it , some parts submerged rocks with other areas suitable for swimming - Devoid of the less pleasant aspects of European beaches .
